WhSjiMRv_BkSbEFh3bY60Q.text: As far as fast food places in that area go, it's definitely one of the best and their late opening hours are really handy. Just watch out for the extra hot sauce that comes in a little bottle - it'll certainly make your eyes water! I should mention that they also do what I've seen labelled as 'crumble dollars': large buns covered with an icing-crumble mix which are actually quite tasty but hard to find in London.

7jAmUzk5MsfGbCOsGQzQRA.text: German Bratwurst served in a roll with sauerkraut and mustard - delicious!!! Next time I go I'm going to try the Bockwurst as they looked really tasty too. They even do a loyalty card - you only have to buy 4 sausages to get one free, brilliant!!

ihFKJXyGCc38kdCQ6OgTVA.text: Quite amazing! Have been here before sober and could not remember what i loved! With the patience of the staff i had AGAIN the best sausage in london. Thank you x

TgIvdEbDac7P2YC0WPx2eA.text: Went here with my brother yesterday when we were nursing a hangover. We both had the currywurst and totally loved it. It doesn't look very appealing when you first get it but boy does it taste good. Also loved the large selection of soft drinks which makes such a nice change from the bland choice of coke or sprite cans in other cafes. Be prepared to take out however as there are very few places to sit. and it's always pretty busy.

pLRkkYUPtkTsVAXQho4ldg.text: I recently popped in here on my way to a night out. I had a Bratwurst with mustard and am happy to confirm that the quality of said Wurst was very much in line with what you get in Germany. And three and a half squids is a reasonable price for a Bratwurst. A friend of mine, a Bratwurst virgin, had one too and really liked it so I guess it is safe to say that Brits will enjoy the concept of Bratwurst as much as ze Germans do.

FwFvyIDVNvbY0dVMpD4Cbg.text: Stopped in for currywurst and pomme frites with a friend, to relive drunken antics in Germany. As long as you love the curry sauce they pour over everything (and I do), this is pretty fantastic. There's also a pretty cool automatic sausage slicing machine that we were mesmerized by. This stuff goes down particularly well after a few drinks. They've also got a case full of interesting sandwiches and pastries - we tried a black and white cookie, which is more cake-like than cookie-like, and I saw a pretzel croissant that looked interesting, though I was too full to sample it. There's a bench outside, but no other seating, so plan on standing at one of the counters to scarf down your food, or take it to go and have a wander while munching.

UtngbO0np1n01mIQ3vRrqA.text: Great tasting bratwurst and chips, not the cheapest you'll find but good for where it is. The coca-kola is great, nice spot to grab a quick meal read the paper and people watch the never ending stream of commuters

fii2oIWQ3rzgoGKSHmeb7Q.text: One of the best Esspreso in the city

1xkHPqMrUoZdu39naR0d2A.text: I am very pleased to have found an authentic currywurst place in central London. I will definitely be going back. Not quite as good overall as a typical Hamburg currywurst haus but the sauce is actually better than German places in my opinion. Sehr gut. Herman ze German also does other snacks, sandwiches and drinks but I ignored these as I was totally fixated on my imminent currywurst.GOOD: Three types of sausage, two pork one beef Top quality currywurst sauce You can choose how spicy you like your currywurst (mmm, very spicy please) German staff, so I could practice my bad German, although they speak perfect English of course BAD: The fries were dry and dull, they tasted as if they had been under the heat lamp too long. No potato salad - they are planning on adding this to the menu soon. No seating other than a bench outside, however Embankment Gardens are just around the corner.

lu02EUVUNIKsTGgYLK-R7g.text: I'd give this place 10 stars if I could Absolutely LOVE HZG. Currywurst with guilt-free fries is my not-too-guilty pleasure. Plus I dont often get to eat sausages as I'm gluten free, but these wurst, are ze best, and have no gluten. I'd come here every lunch if I could. Great for lunch, great for hangover, great for before drinking, great for mid-drinking, great for the trip home after drinking. Oh, and great coffee for the morning. Seht gut! Danke!

V_cL7aXaWm5gx5sOs09nCw.text: I love this place! The Pretzels are amazing!

9aRjFBYl5RfZb5Zi31R_dA.text: Just so you know these sandwiches are ridicously big. The bratwurst is like a foot long. They were actually very tasty. I had the Schnitzel Sandwich which was very dry. Again large portion but just deep fried no sauce. The fries were pretty good.

7JQv-_j0sSZ1TdwEql3iBA.text: This places tastes authentic, but there is something about Currywurst outside Germany that doesn't feel right. The sausage is put into a machine to slice and dumped in a pile in your cardboard tray and covered in sauce. Not difficult to see it wouldn't make a good picture. The seasoning didn't seem well balanced either. My dish was extremely sour with not enough curry and/or chilli powder in it.Service was also a little slow considering how easy a dish this is to make. It should be as quick or quicker than ordering at Macdonalds. Give this a try, but if you get the chance, try Curry 36 in Berlin. Most epic.Edit: I went to another place that did Currywurst in Soho called "The Bratwurst". Having tried that abomination of what they called "currywurst" I felt I was a little harsh about Herman Ze German which was miles ahead in quailty. Added a star as a result

BWWnWiUrZ1sr5svjqmJFmw.text: Very tasty and crispy frites which was piping hot. I had a small curry wurst with mild sauce which was a bit too salty for me and there was too much sauce .Made a mistake of adding on tomato ketchup on the frites, so the whole meal was too salty with too much combination of sauces. Rather expensive for a small wurst with curry sauce,frites and crispy onions at £ 6.95.A small portion of frites on its own costs £2.95.

y8cxW9eTLSODUA1THRwk2g.text: This is a pretty great little fast food joint down by Embankment that provides a taste of Germany to hungry Brits (or in my case, Canadian/Americans). This small establishment is no frills and offers a variety of German sausage with some frites & other fixins that satisfy anyones hunger. The spicy sauce definitely lives up to its name and is worthwhile if you can handle a bit of heat.yes, the machine they use to dice the sausage is a little unsettling to males, simply because it conjures images of severe pain and discomfort, but it's easy to distract oneself from it by immersing oneself in the vast array of sodas or pretzels available for purchase. My only qualm is that they charge you to add sauerkraut to your meal. 50p for cabbage? C'mon, just build it into the cost of my currywurst so that I don't have to pay a 2nd time...

0GLRz4hsWDdFE5Kb1ewQ4A.text: The sausages are great as well as the fries/chips/pommes. Highly recommend the "currywurst" which is a chopped sausage in a basket with fries and curry sauce over the top. Quick, delicious eats!

fSHv85oy309KrFVQjYp2Ew.text: If you can get beyond the very chain-like, impersonal feel of this place, you will say hot-damn, that's a fine sausage!  I was delighted and relieved to find this place open after having drinks at Gordon's wine bar next door.  (It is definitely open past 11 on Fridays at least).  I asked the server what his favorite was and he recommended the chili sausage.  It was AWESOME.  Loved it topped with sauerkraut and a generous squeeze of mustard.Hoping they will open up more of these, especially near the good drinking holes.  Watch out kebabs, you have late-nite alcohol absorbing snacking competition!

hd6MqfNxr0JY2yep2fGi_A.text: Came here on Saturday night at 6:30pm. The shop was seated with 3 tables customer. Is not a big shop on the ground floor. There is bout 7 small tables like canteen style. The sausages are nice. I ordered the one sausage with chips. The staff are friendly. The only reason for one star down is the portion can be bigger. Just one sausage for a portion might be not enough. Before we leave we went down to toilet and realised actually there are more space downstairs and with a big screen playing some movie or movie trailer which is really nice if you come with s group of friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. This took me a while to think 3 or 4 stars?! Nice sausage but only these many ~_~!!

PnWeVvQsAukS4n6IAKfotw.text: Been wanting to go and try this for a while but never had the chance so far. Just happened to pass by when I had to stop, walk a few step backwards and double check I wasn't imagining it. Quickly made my way inside and ordered a bratwurst in roll with mustard, ketchup and roasted onion (I don't do sauerkraut). The guy making it was great and quite chatty, just adding to the feel of the place. Not being English I quite enjoyed having a proper sausage (yes, IMHO, etc.) in London. The bratwurst was quite filling and very nice. Will have to go back again when I get the chance. Oh, don't worry about getting all messy having your sausage. That's what the sink in the corner is for!

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

zbqdsNpoUYSASbw51UqpOg.text: I love Bratwurst and when I saw this shop, which happens to be next to my hotel I was quite excited. The reality hit me when I walked in and realized that this place is not going to be great and certainly will come nowhere near the bratwurst stalls in Munich. Had I walked in after a few pints I might have given it a five ;-) The curry sauce could probably be found in many cheap Indian restaurants around London and spicy means medium and I should have chosen the super hot option. All in all if I happen to hungry after a few pints I would pick a curry first, Herman ze German next and a kebab shop as a last resort. The food is not bad and the French fries were nicely spiced.

nF6NDyRzPjj522a1XllZqw.text: First off, this place easily deserves a five. When I first visited this place on vacation you can smell the rich sausage awesomeness from the street. The staff is very welcoming and warm. Met the owner in the wee hours and gave my friends and I a brief history behind this awesome establishment. All in all, juicy sausages, great service and the buns are top notch.

vHRjkfw5MSVj1pKKQTN-Fg.text: I was very excited to find this as we were looking for lunch in Villiers St.  German food! Home food! Most importantly: CURRYWURST!I tried the currywurst with pork sausage (i.e. normal Bratwurst) and the mild sauce, with a side of fries. The sausage was cut up in slightly too big pieces for my taste, but it was very good, the sauce was just like a proper currywurst sauce needs to be.The fries/chips/pommes (whatever you will call them) however, disappointed me. They were very stale and tasteless or overcooked (crunchy, but not in a good way at all!), I ended up leaving half of them. That kind of surprised me, especially after reading the good comments about the fries in the other reviews. Maybe I just got unlucky and had a bad batch?The fact that they had Fritz Kola made me weep a little bit. Tiny piece of home! Although they were fresh out of the normal cola and instead just had some other fancy mixes (i.e. coffee cola or cherry cola, melon lemonade etc). Again, unlucky, but all the more reason to go back when they're in stock again! :DMy Canadian friend, who had German food for the first time, was quite happy as well.Staff are very friendly and German-speaking, at least the one who served me was.Definitely worth going back to, despite the fries! Next time I should try the Sauerkraut, I think. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

Pib05hfG0uAl0Qk0iHt4Bg.text: Don't listen to the other reviewers.I frequent to this place with my German buddies (from the war (against school work)). If you order in German, you get the same quality of service, by the way.If you don't know what to get, I recommend currywurst with pommes frites. It's basically chopped sausage in bbq sauce topped with curry powder with a side of fresh fries. This will cost you about £4 or £5.They take cards, but you have to spend at least £5, otherwise you get charged extra. If that's "a bit pricey" for you, then you can try the McDonald's down the street.Also, if you're sick, the food here will not heal you. You're just going to have crappy food all day, no matter where you go, Lizzie. :OTake-away is pretty best, since the restaurant is tiny. Sitting at the one table, even when it's empty, is a bit uncomfortable (especially since legitimate Germans are so big). There's also a sink where you can wash your hands with. A sink out in the open for all to use!Anyway, this place is pretty cool, because their logo is a mustachioed sausage named herman.

7puY66G1DhYMBFSIk5EVjA.text: After missing the real thing too much, I tried out Herman ze German and now can't stop going back!Great Bratwurst, good selection of different sausages, and very friendly service. They even stock Fritz bottles which are great.Reasonably priced for the authenticity/location/novelty value.Even bought one of their bags!

AtT8bUVM_INSE6U6QOVEYw.text: Anyway who knows me, knows I do like a good bit of sausage. ;-)I've always liked sausages but after living in Australia a few years ago and visiting Berlin last year, I have more appreciation than before for this juicy meat treats. On our way home from our boxing class and en route to Charing Cross, we were starving and our friend suggested a visit as he adores the place and having just done exercise it wouldn't count - well that's my story and I'm sticking to it. I can see why he loves the place. Since this visit, we've returned twice and I would recommend it.The establishment is small but nice and well stocked, there is a very friendly and welcoming feel too. The service is great and I recommend the Bratwurst, Bockwurst and the Sauerkraut.

ZFKd746vDEMWkhA4nZMKRw.text: Last December a friend introduced me to this place, and one day when I passed by it I couldn't resist to pop in. Since then I go there from time to time. Friendly [more or less German speaking] staff, delicious Currywurst and fritz-limo! They even sell Pretzels, flat sausage, and other stuff.So far I think the best Currywurst place in London!

hXpA1hnDwcFbU573FQBzIg.text: Great food, reasonably priced and always really friendly staff.The food tastes good, really authentic, just like the one I had during my last trip to Germany.My personal favourite is the "flat sausage in a roll" or "Leberkassemmel", I never thought I would be able to get it outside Germany.Drinks are good as well, I like the fact that they serve Fritz Cola, from an independent Germany drinks company run by two young guys.The shop looks nice as we'll, so thumbs up overall!

hHOiiQxPbxgzizAX8ItObA.text: Small place with limited seating but quick turnovers. Got a roll, chips, and soda for 8.55. Got the free crispy onions too and enjoyed that. Overall, better than an american hot dog, juicy, not too salty. The German soda was really good too, not too sweet. The chips (fries) were ok, not as crispy as the America kind but better than others I've had. I would go back again and rec to others for a quick and cheap eat.

pqF7PlDyvgoKKqAL0ZdA_g.text: Authentic German Currywurst, just choose how spicy you want it. Much dearer than when found in its native habitat, but that's what you'd expect. Does Bratwurst too. Lecker!

e9vJ03DHjz-CuEWvHT8FfQ.text: I nice little shop, perfect for a quick German food fix. Good food and friendly service.

W8WodzSAnPekCbjyagy4tg.text: Hmm, looked good...I like a good german place...Im pretty easily pleased...open late...awesome...but the meatballs were so terrible...the only way i can describe it is ball shaped salty dog food...my friend and i felt like we should spit out the food in our napkin, but we had a plan to be the opposite of the offensive american...so we swallowed it down.   then we grabbed more sauerkraut and i kid you not, the guy asked for more money.  there is a chance, i may come back next week for a sausage...seems only fair.  but beware....i hardly ever ever ever give one stars and i would give this place zero if possible.

0BvC8miL3WMrwJGhzs2rkA.text: Herman Ze German!!! where have you been all my life?!? honestly I have gone past this place a million times. I often made fun of its name but I never dared to go in! It just looked like a shitty tourist hole in the wall!Well this ladies and gents is a fine example not to judge a book by its cover! Ze Uber Ding!! you have won me over! Chili Wurst with Jalapeños, Mustard, Fried Onions, & Cheese... I asked for Sauerkraut and Pickles (Gherkins) on mine as well... what a tasty treat indeed! best hot dogs outside of America!

YkqJM1qGA_JOUWKtSvW1mw.text: Popped in here on Saturday night on our way to a late-night museum showing. The staff weren't exactly friendly - when one of them informed me that there was no chilli wurst, and I asked if there was anything at all with chilli on it (my partner likes having his head blown off during every meal...), the woman on the counter got quite tetchy with me and repeated that there was NO chilliwurst (which wasn't what I was asking - as a sober London-dweller with an RP accent, I can't have been too difficult to understand, so I've no idea why she got so grumpy). After which she told me that I could put jalapeños on the dog. So there was an option after all... Not a great start!So, in the end, we both ended up with bockwursts, my partner with jalapeños, and me with crispy onions, and some fries. He really enjoyed his, and I wasn't overly impressed - it was filling, and tasty, but I didn't think it was anything particularly noteworthy in terms of German cuisine. I've had better, and worse, takeaway German sausage, in England and in Germany.Overall, nothing wrong with it. Tasty, filling, and cheap, but not a culinary experience to put off for a long time in anticipation (I've been excited to go for two years!) or you'll be disappointed, and possibly told off if you dare to hunt down jalapeños when they're out of chilliwurst...!

LJHtYNtNQo7wb3wCKfonIA.text: Best wurst in London. The curry sauce is amazing. The wursts are delicious, flavourful, and have a bite to them. Apart from the wursts though, other things on the menu that deserve a mention are the schnitzel and the fries/frittes. They are crunchy, crisp, and freshly made.They have a huge selection of German soft drinks on the shelves. I particularly liked the cola and the lemonade.

tvHHJGB7myhI_2NfWKsBLA.text: The service here was fantastic and it has been the first German bratwurst spot I have found that is even slightly close to being in Germany. Quick service and great food.

X_tX0Gysf5ze29REc5ZdLw.text: Holy deliciousness. I'm usually not really into soy products or meat substitutes, and try to get most of my nutrients naturally, but I have a weird fondness for vegetarian hot dogs. That said, they all taste so damn artificial. That notion stopped when I ordered and devoured the veggie wurst from Herman Ze German. It was, by far, the best vegetarian sausage I've ever had - ever. We ordered our 'wurts with some cheesy pommes, a departure from our normal healthy code of eating ethics. That said, so worth it. They were super crispy and well seasoned, and the cheese had this incredible depth of flavor, unlike the highly processed varieties you may find at other chains.

pIuazvkVOZLg9Y2sYDB6_A.text: Probably the best hot dog I have ever eaten in my life. Crisp sausage with a juicy core. Delicious fries perfectly seasoned. Spent about 20 pounds for 2 soda, 2 dogs with fries and extra side of cheese fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

KOOL_VztNDLXfpWfVtEwSg.text: I had a chilli wurst for lunch and it was quite good.  The quality of the bread and wurst were outstanding and the mustard was excellent too.My only complaint was that it was packed with people and it is quite a small place.  The price of success I guess.

3bPIIzSKAXJPl5JiSUL3gg.text: Currywurst in London?? CURRYWURST IN LONDON!! Yay!!H ze G is in the perfect place to line your tummy before heading on for drinks or comedy shows. The staff seem vaguely friendly but very busy ...they are happy when German folk wander in and order in their own language.I've tried a hotdog, which was pretty good... but it's the currywurst with pommes frites that really hits the sausage.* Warning 1: Don't expect the currywurst sauce to taste like UK-style curry. It's like Germany...so tastes more like happy, slightly spicy tomato ketchup.** Warning 2: They have a brilliant machine that automatically chops your sausage into bite-sized-munchable pieces. Blokes shouldn't look too carefully at this chopper of phallic-like meat...it makes them look scared.

d1kFbWZ4ZXhPvquSi5Ahyw.text: How have I never eaten here before? My chicken schnitzel rivaled ones I've had in Berlin and NY. so good!My only complaint is that they ran out of fries and pork schnitzel but it was late night! Guess I'll just have to come back...Also may give your heartburn. Your results may vary. Its a little pricey for a sandwich but worth it!

15ANKOz6xbTLE3sBCMBQ9w.text: Had the "Ze Wilde Bock Roll" and the pork "Schnitzel" with "Pommes spezial". The fries and bock roll was full of flavor. The pork was greasy and didn't have any flavor. Staff was nice. Place is small. This is perfect for a quick bite.

EpxDNuDmsUe2HvI-WuFCSw.text: -off day for H ze G?  Das hoffe ich...Pet peeve #432: repeating my order (klar und deutlich) in excess of three times only to receive not really what I had asked for while a co-worker, standing next to me, looks on and says nothing to help.  Gracias, Jesus.  Meh.I've enjoyed past trips here and expect that this underwhelming experience is just a blip on the radar screen, as it were.

-wUpRWaV5hKBFc7Ys9HdLA.text: Stopped in for a quick brattie after a gig at Heaven. Bratwurst are my one of my favourite foods; the best ones I've had being the krakauer at London Bridge. The service was fast and the place looks cute and clean.We had the bratwurst, with all the toppings which I was pleased about, because the sausage itself was pretty bland. Not the best one I've ever had, but sated a brattie craving for a while until I head back to Berlin.

gM2opU8VLSmLwg0L3BscRw.text: If you're after something simple and cheap, then this is the place to go. Offering different combos, with so many toppings, you'll never get bored. However, due to its location it can get very busy and the last time I was here there was a long wait. (Visit - 17/07/2015 Dinner)

yrQ4uHbt7phQa2PbijE54g.text: I have yet to try the sausage - which most of my colleagues rave about but when I'm out picking up something for lunch, the last thing I think of wanting is a currywurst. I'll save that for a drunken pub night out.Whenever I go to Germany, esp around Bavaria, I always have to get a pretzel.  When this place first opened, I think I would pick up a pretzel once a week.  I don't know why I love it so much but I can't get enough.  Are you an American that misses filter (drip) coffee?  An american colleague told me to get the filtered coffee because it reminded her of Dunkin Donuts coffee back home.  It's not exactly the same but it's a good quick fix until my next trip to NY.

zfpxuPAcZgxZ_LBCZ66G6g.text: This is a slightly bigger than 'hole in the wall' wurst place, that serves up Bavarian fast-food fare at breakneck speed. Serves wurst in a bun, currywurst, pommes and more recently, chicken or pork schnitzel.Staff are polite and swift. The sausages can also be bought in vac-pac form if you fancy taking them home.Overall, quick tasty post-drinking fare, reasonably priced, with limited seating, which is close to a mainline rail and Tube station.

1IDdv9MuEvQyBUiH31Kiog.text: Super tasty sausages and yummy baked (but don't seem it) fries. Not much seating, but lots of nearby space for eating if you can't find a spot. The bockwurst are taaaasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

MSiXrQJnYJuyv8IIAZJo9Q.text: German fast-food. Of course, being German it is customarily quite efficient, and the food was served to my taste. I needed to grab a quick and dirty lunch to lug back to my cube, and decided to try this on some recommendations from the office.I had a brat with fries, and one of their private label "colas". I have to say, I was extremely satisfied. Fast food prices are much higher than in the US, but for London this is a cheap eat, especially so close to Whitehall and Trafalgar Square.Noting the mixed reviews for this place, I would note that I went for lunch during a particularly busy weekday, so they were moving product. The brat was hot, the bun was fresh, and the fries were very tasty. I would imagine if you hit this place on a slow weekend, your experience may be very different.All in all, a definite repeat for a weekday lunch. Next time I will have to grab my lunch and eat outside in the nearby park for a more relaxed and enjoyable meal rather than at my desk!

tWEbRkqlDOZkqybdc1ysmA.text: This place has a really cool atmosphere. The staff, the seasoning, and the concept were all a fun experience for me but I didn't totally love the bratwurst which is why I gave it 4 stars. I'll go back and try some others.

R-iPzAyyF0xT_9rcAMP7lw.text: Picture this: an Italian decides to visit Italy for the first time. With an afternoon flight, she needs a late lunch before heading to the airport. Tubes are all whacky given the holidays, and she ends up at Embankment looking to switch to the Northern line, but still hungry. Okay, good plan, pop off the tube at Embankment and walk up toward Leicester Square to catch the Piccadilly line. Cue: Herman ze German.Absolutely delicious.I am always skeptical when I walk in for German food, because I visited Munich and love love loved the food. It wasn't gourmet when I visited, but it was authentic. So when the dude behind the counter says my currywurst will be better at Herman ze German than I had at the small takeaway near Neuschwanstein castle... Like I said, I'm skeptical. Cue: awesome food entering my life.It was great--cheap and easy to take away, delicious and pretty much exactly what I had in Germany (I'm "pleading the fifth" in my American way, and not saying which is better). I'd highly recommend this as a spot to grab a quick bite before seeing the sights in the area. I can also imagine it's quite the good late-night food, given the venues in the area. Two thumbs up, er, five stars from me.

i4vpJRIa-C-RyOlo_jIodQ.text: Sorry Herman, I just don't want to be porked by YOUR sausage. Just sayin'!Any excuse to lower the tone. I'm going to love any place that serves meat and carbs. Actually, a sausage specialist such as Herman ze German should really be a fave of faves. But the phrase "not so much" comes to mind. I was a little under the weather and hadn't eaten anything that day when walking past this place I got very excited. I've been wangling after this First To Review for a while.If ever their was a soulless snack bar this would be it. With all this cute marketing I was expecting so much more but the wurst was only okay and the sauerkraut was so disappointing. Not warmed up and with no bacon in it - what were they thinking?As a lunch time spot, it's not awful, it's just not great. They'll have to try harder to impress me. Even their strange array of German fizzy pop didn't wow me.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

F2G75x33HJ8aX0FINzMWBQ.text: My husband found us Herman Ze German while we were wandering London on a Saturday, and we ended up having a great lunch here!It's a small place but very bright and clean, and the guys working the counter were friendly.  There aren't a ton of sausage options, but what they have is very good, and there are plenty of toppings and sauces to choose from.  My husband was sensible and had a chili wurst ( £4.45) topped with mustard and sauerkraut.  I was adventurous and tried "Ze Wilde Bock Roll":  an insane combination of bockwurst, curry sauce, crispy onions, mayo and fries ( £5.95).  Why have I not thought of putting curry on a sausage before?  It's delicious!  I ended up picking the fries up off the top and eating them on the side, but they were crispy and yummy, and the whole combination surprisingly worked really well.Quick service, great food and low prices = 5 stars.

8oDQJkjHU9uXQ2wbK3jmOw.text: I had the curry wurst because it came recommended, and it was delicious. I added sauerkraut because why not, and the spicy mustard topped things off nicely. Good atmosphere, excellent food, I would eat here again.

t0LNE_fAlnpuvS22s7VARA.text: Simple, cheap, and tasty. The staff is nice (at least one of them speaks German) and the fries are really good!

vzeJZzbUglnkq8BTIp0p5A.text: The food here is delicious. It was warm and tasty. A definite treat to eat for lunch. The ladies that work here are super sweet. If we ever come back to London, we will come back to eat here again.

GrPZ81fSgfmG06-IGaQ46w.text: Got a Pork Sausage Chili Dog on a bun with a side of plain fries all for £8 ($11-12). If you're in the area, it's a great stop to get a quick bite and either have it in the shop if you find any seats OR have it at the park which is only a few steps away. Sausage was great, it's a footlong sausage and I got mine with ketchup, mustard and mayo. I may try to add sauerkraut next time.

DuYxQEBAWb9YhubQL6lQGg.text: I headed down to Charing Cross to attend a seminar at the hotel in the train station. But it was right after lunch, and I needed something to eat. I've been wanting to give Mr. Herman a go for ages, so I stopped in to grab something for lunch.The venue is tiny, so I had to get it for takeaway as there's only enough room for about eight people. Good thing it was a sunny (but cold) day, and Trafalgar Square was oh so close.I'm a bit of a spice fiend, so I opted for Ze Uber Ding. Chilli Wurst? Check. Jalapenos? Check. Cheese? Check! Fries? CHECK CHECK CHECK!They also melt the cheese and jalapenos in a pan and dump it on top of the sausage so it's oozy and amazing. And delicious and spicy. I also got some potato salad to try (and probably could have done without).I did really enjoy it. I'm sure I'll be back sometime.

J_r4_BqldOC8Ut3R6TX_lA.text: Just so you know this review is from an American visiting England and eating German food in London. Yep that's messed up!That being said Herman Ze German has some really great sausages or as we call them in the USA dawgs. My sausage was crunchy on the outside and had just the write snap to it but it was soft on the inside. The way they are in Chicago!Herman Ze German is a small place with great food and not too much seating. So this means you get to eat standing up or cross your fingers you get a spot at the table. As an FYI its well worth it! In my opinion Herman Ze German hat sehr gut essen und nicht so teuer!I am looking forward to eating there the next time I am in London.

KPNSrLce20VWuWKFSrqmaA.text: They claim that their Wurst is Ze Best... I had a bit of time to kill before heading back to work, so I thought I'd check out if Herman Ze German lived up to its expectations!I got Currywurst with chips. The wurst was good (not too greasy, good flavour), but I'm not sure I liked the curry sauce that much (it was a bit too sweet for me). The chips however were very VERY good (with loads of curry-salt)!! No matter what you do, GET THE CHIPS (and probably the free crispy onion topping too, because YOLO)!Currywurst + Pommes was £5.95 I think. Rolls around £5. Sounds like a great lunch deal to me!cakeandwhisky.wordpress.…

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Herman ze German
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Herman ze German
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Decisions, decisions... Fritz Cola, Herman ze German

G_6lKTQBVs0ZxzZC0iiJTA.text: I don't get all the amazing reviews?????? I had the bratwurst in a bun and side of fries. My meal was average at best. Given my German background, I'm a little insulted that this is passed as good German food.The Bratwurst itself was OK but served lukewarm. The bun was just terrible - cold, hard and too large for the size of the sausage. The Sauerkraut was tasteless. So incredibly disapointed. Fries were the "wurst' I had in London. Small, hard and overcooked.  It's cool that they serve Fritz cola from Hamburg which I enjoy on my many trips to Hamburg. They also have local Hamburg brewed beer "Astra" available.Again.... I just don't get it. Very disapointed and no expectation to return.BK

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Bratwurst
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Soda from Hamburg Germany

hpcaRM7d6dIQZzKD95fttg.text: It's sausages and pommes, and to be honest, having just come back from Berlin, it's pretty close to the 'real' thing! A slightly hungover me went in for some lunch and walked out a much happier person. Never seen their method of making fries before but they are tasty! I think it's a really big version of an Actify that rotates vertically instead of horizontally. What does come out is a nice crispy fry that holds sauce well.This location doesn't have much seating and what it does have is tight, being beside Charing Cross it's also quite busy.I recommend getting the Currywurst with Pommes, although I'll let you choose what sausage to get, I think they're all good.

8x3gVKkpjqA9NfQysF8PZQ.text: I'm usually not the biggest fan of hot dogs, sausages, wursts, that sort of thing. But I came to this restaurant after an running event (haha, eating back my calories) and I was very satisfied. Great wurst and great fries. Fast service and friendly staff.

7DesZQjLy80sfB3KNHGB2w.text: Chaotic sums up the experience. Server looked like he was in a trance when I gave him my order.  Servers interrupt and talk to each other while talking to a customer. Selfish customers waiting for orders occupy the pitifully few seats leaving those with food to juggle and find a spot on a shelf over the (covered) rubbish bin. The final insult - £8 for bratwurst in roll and large drinking cup of fries. (Curious why a German-themed eaterie would insist they are pommes frites another symptom of the confusion running through the place.)

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. An experience mot to be repeated

egk0QpoIWeW9wITVc8DjLg.text: Oh, how many great evenings we've had here.  This little shop has fed me plenty of times and food is the best. Everyone is obsessed about the curry sauce, but honestly, cheese fries are heaven. At this tiny kingdom, they make fast food taste better, but also grill the sausages so It is a lot healthier.  Having lived in Berlin, I have to say they get pretty close to German ones.H ze G is my favourite place to eat after a hangover. You must give it a try.

0bsqN4_nlYcgX6eYGOZVyg.text: I'd heard good things about ze German and had been intending to visit for a while. I was not disappointed - I had a brat with fries and a cola. Firstly the fries are somehow baked not fried - I didn't notice this until they were halfway gone because I was trying to double fist them into my mouth - they're that good. I only found out because it said so on a sign - there's no way you could tell from the taste.The brat was the best I've had, and I've been to Germany a few times as well as scoffed brats at a series of German Christmas markets in the uk.The cola was unusual - not a brand I'm familiar with but it was interesting with notes of burdock and pepper. I'd order it again - far better than some lukewarm fountain Coke.

EPl3o0MQ2ZbQ9kmHLFSswQ.text: In Soho there is an ever expanding list of delicious places to go and try. However, many of these places are absolutely useless if you're in a rush. While sometimes it's lovely to have a leisurely dinner, sometimes you need to be in and out and if so, this is your place. Specialising in German sausage, it is very no frill. You choose your sausage, whether it comes with a bun, salad or chips and you're done. They have some toppings you can add such as curry sauce, onions, cheese, pickles etc which are great. The chips can also have toppings if you wish. With rotating specials there are a lot of combinations to try. As it was my first time I went with a simple bratwurst and it was really nice. It was served in a fresh, white crusty roll and topped with mustard and tomato sauce was gorgeous. Be warned - it's very filling. For a meal that topped out at £10 it is tasty and impeccable value.

8nysV0jiIgNx6vokHjuJrA.text: I still don't understand why Timeout have such an obsession with the restaurant, it's average. Completely average. Nothing more and nothing less. I can see the benefit of going here after a couple of drinks, but that is it. Heard mixed reviews of this place as well from friends ranging from horrendous to amazing.

-terZh1Q549GadghMoyU4g.text: In preparation for my trip to Germany over Easter, I popped into Herman ze German to acclimatise my palateAs I appreciate a good pun, I was glad to see that they haven't missed the opportunity to say 'our wurst is ze best'! Very un-German humour but most appreciated by me!They do a range of sausages reminiscent of the many fast food stands I've seen in Germany. The range of sausages are grilled and therefore more healthy than the fried versions I've seen in Germany. I took mine sprinkled with their curry-tomato sauceThey're a bit pricier than the German versions but if you're nostalgic for some german fast food, do pop in here

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

IJUHoAf9rbljH3-4wKYfLw.text: LOVE this place! I got the chili wurst and salad. I felt it was a nicely balanced meal, haha. It tasted authentic, the workers are very friendly, the aesthetic of the restaurant is a nice hipster vibe. Try their cider drinks as well, they're a great complement to the meal and is around 2 pounds.

3gbpiijgfJaaBF3JNHIwWw.text: Herman ze German is the best tasting currywurst I have ever had... FACT. And I've been to Hamburg a lot.The only thing that lets this place down is that it's menu is quite complex... for instance you can have a normal wurst in a roll for £4, but not with chips or you pay another £2... yet currywurst and chips is £5... but a roll will set you back another £1... I would recommend studying the menu first! And then going for the currywurst mit pommes with the hottest curry sauce they have... lovely!

TrzQxdi2NRSSK0pucjkUgQ.text: Stopped in here as we were starving and this place didn't have a line.I ordered a bratwurst and the pmmes spezial. I was told that for a few extra p I could get a water and I did. When my order was called up it was wrong! He ended up ringing me up for the meal deal that they have rather than the pommes spezial. I was hungry and didn't mind, but when they called my friends order, they got their's wrong too!!The actual bratwurst was ok. I liked all the toppings you could get on, but I felt a bit ill later from the food. The pommes frites were nice with the mayo, but I think next time I'm going to wait in line somewhere else.It was also pretty pricey for the food you get.

XP4bvs-gt5Kaky-spS4KXA.text: I was worried the name was a stereotypical trope, but the schnitzel was solid, the wurst was the best, and the service was friendly. It seems like I should give it less of a rating for being fast food, but they're on point.

RQanpS7lMpPDC62H96qOKg.text: The hotdogs here were delicious! I am happy that we came here to eat. They have different ways to eat the sausages. You can get then in a bun, with fries, or in curry sauce. I ordered a sausage in a bun with fries. The fries were good and the bun was delicious. They gave a good amount of food and I had to save half for lunch. The place is small, so it was kind of hard to get a seat for a larger group. The workers were super nice and patient. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a quick and inexpensive place to eat while you are in London.

_bmEyGv2Cako6ynaLbpPtA.text: Under glowing blue string lights, Villiers Street is home to Herman ze German & about another dozen quick-serve restaurants. We chose to do a take away, but there are a handful of seats, if you're so inclined to eat in. I absolutely enjoyed my order -- a Vegan Wurst (made of seitan) on a roll with all the free toppings (ketchup, mustard, mayo, & crispy onions) & added sauerkraut & curry sauce (50p each) on the side. (Sidenote: This was my first time trying curry sauce & the flavor is not for me. I expected it to be yellow like the curry I'm used to, but it was red like ketchup!) My wurst was ginormous, almost a foot long, I believe. I barely had room but I swiped a few of her fries, which were good & crispy. I have to admit, my stomach hated me a little in the morning. Will keep my eyes peeled for other HzG locations in London. Veggie friendly, nice & tasty, a slew of toppings, & all for around £6.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

YE12NV2s-t3uUwTpo1Ld8g.text: Good dog! About 9 pounds for fries and dog. Highly recommended . Hack get a water cup instead of a drink . Save money and stay hydrated

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

J-d70ddetmTSsXRTBrf0FQ.text: Hands down !! The best curry fries ever !! The Vegan Hot Dog hit the spot along with its Melonlimonade !!Staff was amazing and provided options and recommendations . Place was clean and well maintained !!

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Vegan dog with Melonlimonade
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Arrival and departure of your order
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Curry fries

obB2L4DrZLRpbbLd0Iavjg.text: Love German food, and this is  a great place to grab it.Street German food would be a better description. I had a sausage with the usual bun and German mustard.Pricing is a bit expensive though. What you'd pay 2 euros for a the train station in Berlin, you're paying £8 here. Saying that, you sort of expect that in a place like London

yE-mqMkL3YycfSPz1DQ9nQ.text: Encouraged by good reviews stopped by. Although sign said ask staff about allergens none of three at counter could tell us what dairy allergic customer could have. Their chart in kitchen all three shrugged and said they couldn't understand. Obviously no allergen safety training so we left. No safety training doesn't work for us. They also couldn't share their allergen chart w us since it was stuck to the wall in prep area

8f45h-yaogItlT7io0zzlA.text: I visited 2 of their locations when I was visiting London back in August and the food is amazing! I had the 'Ze wilde bock roll' with fries and loved it.

RUN95_dBQUzZbbOIH0L5vg.text: Definite "must go" if you want cheap, authentic, and ridiculously delicious sausages. There are so many options. Also-- you get a LOT of food. Honestly though--the best thing on the menu is the fries. Get them with cheese and you will watch them melt cheese in a skillet until it is nice and bubbly and a little golden brown and then literally just pour it over the already perfectly seasoned fries. 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

oVzV7IZr5vitLMflYKrXKw.text: The brats were great! Got the lunch special so got fries and slaw and those were pretty damn good too! Overall impressive!

tZ0IQNkODOnwbh43VGlcqQ.text: Not a fan. Super salty and not nice nor my kind of food at all. Staff recommended I purchase the spicy special one. Can't remember the name. It was just salty. Not spicy. And I felt ikky after eating it as it was also super greasy...Not going back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

-1PyPb9H_W17DWY2AyhZ1Q.text: Adorable little shop with a simple menu, just choose the type of sausage you want and how you want it. Although it sounded a little questionable, the currywurst with chips was amazing.

E5M_l-K6vDX1T_Ztfr8Gpg.text: I loved this place even though I'm normally not a big German food person. I would recommend the cheese fries. They day I went it was freezing out, and the fries were warmth to my soul. I also got chick sandwich, was so big I couldn't finish it. The only downside is that there were no bathrooms so make sure you go before you come here. Other than that, delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Cheese fries and chicken sandwich

jUxHYsovAiMK7CzdfLsCEw.text: I'm half German so just happy to find a place that does things close enough to the street vendor variety I could find in my Mother's home town of Hamburg.I just feel spoilt for choice here and gosh darn it if the Wurst isn't just scrummy.I think the pricing is very reasonable for what you get and, while there is minimal communal seating, they seem to have quite a quick turnover so it's busy, buzzing but never packed.Service is really fast and friendly and YES they respond to German in German and this is a great alternative to fast food of the bland variety (not names mentioned)I kind of went for it here as I felt like a kid in a candy store or a German in a Bratwurst Store may be more apt.  I had the Wurst Deal which included a Hotdog, Fries and a drink at under a tenner.  I added a few toppings and you can customise the chilli level or type of wurst to make it your own.  The chilli certainly catches you off guard and while I didn't feel it while consuming I had a healthy glow by the end.  I did not walk away hungry that much I can assure you!They have a unique range of soft drinks that go down with ease and, within my little group of yelpers, we tasted a couple and they were very popular.Hot dogs can be a messy business so the sink to wash up is very handy.Not 100% authentic but close enough to conjure up memories of my childhood summer holidays.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Like the Frites so much forgot to photograph them till they were nearly gone!

cdYNS93JmBlOWXEs6i7uTA.text: German sausage anyone??  Reasonably priced. Not a lot of seating but I guess thats represented in the cost of the wurst.. I went for the wurst salad combo.. And I braved it with the spicy option which at first was too spicy but the best creeps up on you and before you know your mouth is on fire??? The apple,  cheery and elderflower fizz was yummy.. I am gonna need to go back to try the other option too! And if you are a messy eater then they have catered for you with a sink to wash up.. Cause if you managed to get by with no mess,  then you need either more topping or more sauce.. Lol  they give fried onions out for free but all other additions do need to be paid for but 50p for gherkins?  I can manage that!

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Best fizz ever
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. The healthier option
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. May tackling the wurst

AfwC2ZSZjdPIZGHELPAUZw.text: I came upon this place during a night stroll and the catchy name of this place caught my attention. German food in London? Hell yeah! I got the recommendation with Lucifer's sauce on it, aka the ringer - that sounded kind of wrong. The service was extremely nice and friendly, props to those guys who were working that night. They made my day. Back onto the food, I had no idea what to expect from this place since we barely have any German food where I live but man, the first bite was gooooood. A little bit of sauce, a little of fries, a little bit of crunchy onions, a little bit of Sauerkraut, and best of all, a little bit of sausages and BAM, I was flavor town. Then came the heat. The ringer is not for the hot sauce virgins I warn you. I totally didn't expect a habanero level of spiciness but I definitely recognized its potency. Boy was it good and what a rush it was. I wished that we had Herman ze German in Canada, I know I'd go there everyday during work.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Fucking spicy fucking delicious.

nmNSBpXT6d41KQWhOXgnpg.text: I've never been big on German food, but after HzG (and a trip to Germany), I'm a convert. Get the bockwurst and add toppings. You won't be disappointed.

uFAKekW9GQAqr8d-Ni6HIA.text: Honestly one of the best places I have found! Would love for this to become a larger restaurant brand. Love it!Edit: Came back to London after 9 months and the first thing I did was grab a bite from here.The Currywurst is mild but adding a pinch of the ringer will solve that The fries are the perfect balance of heft and flavor that make them a must try.The soda is delightful.If you can go here do so as soon as humanly possible.

mAwU0V2SwWug2tS7hgDsew.text: Hit the spot!  My friend is German and while I was visiting London we had only one night out - she wanted to take me someplace with food that I couldn't get in New York, something authentic - and she took me to Herman ze German!  Currywurst was excellent and chips fried to perfection. Staff was super friendly - can't wait to come back to London and pay Herman a visit!

TGE-Ws-qruRLBCHg13uKlQ.text: I loved this place it was a walking distance from the hotel we stayed at ! It's a small place but the food is great the service is outstanding a must try
